alert.note: Alert for Sullivan; Vigo (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 10:09PM EST until February 03 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...Illinois... Wabash River from Lafayette to Riverton. .Lowland flooding has developed along the Wabash River. Minor flooding could be made worse by any ice jams that develop as river ice breaks up with the warmer temperatures and moves downstream. This ice jam threat should come to an end over the weekend, but minor river flooding along the Wabash is expected to continue well into next week, aided by additional rainfall expected during the weekend. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY, FEBRUARY 03... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Terre Haute. * WHEN...Until Saturday, February 03. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, The Wabash River extends to Interstate 70 Mile Marker Number 4 from its west bank in the Terre Haute and West Terre Haute area. All lakes in this area are affected by seep water and reach capacity with some minor flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM EST Friday /8:30 PM CST Friday/ the stage was 17.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 PM EST Friday /8:30 PM CST Friday/ was 17.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 21.1 feet Tuesday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday, February 03. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued Saturday afternoon by around noon EST /1100 AM CST/.
